instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1989: What is A1989? A1989 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2018, 2019 with EMC 3124, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00850..
definitions.820-00850: What is 820-00850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: MB Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>  2018
threads.message: I got in a macbook pro that supposedly was not charging or powering on. When i received it, i plugged it in and the devices powered on but is only pulling between .50 to .80 amps and the wattage is moving between 40.5 to 48 w. What is the normal amps reading for this device and where could i find a schematic for this device.

threads.title: MB Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>  2018
threads.message: also forgot to add the battery count is at 350

threads.title: MB Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>  2018
threads.message:
820-xxxxx board code???
Did you check for USB acivity, external video?

threads.title: MB Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>  2018
threads.message: I do have usb activity  and external video, im repeating the question how much amps should a healthy board be taking and how do I find the board code.

threads.title: MB Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>  2018
threads.message:
I do not understand your problem then.
Do you also get internal video, machine works perfectly???

What is that concern about ampers?
It depends by many things, like battery state, current CPU activity, backlight level...

threads.title: MB Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>  2018
threads.message:
Board number is <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. It's written on the board.
20V (on USB-C) at 0.5A to 0.8A is 10W to 16W, not 40W to 48W.
